intro: Flickingeria calopogon, commonly known as the bog orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the wetlands of eastern North America. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in acidic, boggy soils and requires a humid, shaded environment to thrive. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the nutrient-poor peat soils in which it is found. Due to habitat loss, Flickingeria calopogon is considered endangered in many regions, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
